data.title: 75 Notable Alumni of Osaka University [Sorted List]
data.meta_description: Below is the list of 75 notable alumni from Osaka University sorted by their wiki pages popularity. The directory includes famous graduates and former students along with research and academic staff.
data.meta_site_name: EduRank.org - Discover university rankings by location
data.text:
75 Notable alumni of

Osaka University

Updated: February 29, 2024

EduRank

Osaka University is 122nd in the world, 19th in Asia, and 12th in Japan by aggregated alumni prominence. Below is the list of 75 notable alumni from Osaka University sorted by their wiki pages popularity. The directory includes famous graduates and former students along with research and academic staff.

Osamu Tezuka

Born in

Japan

Years

1928-1989 (aged 61)

Enrolled in Osaka University

Studied medicine

Occupations

television producerillustratorfilm directorfilm produceranimator

Biography

Osamu Tezuka was a Japanese manga artist, cartoonist and animator. Born in Osaka Prefecture, his prolific output, pioneering techniques and innovative redefinitions of genres earned him such titles as "the Father of Manga" (マンガの父, Manga no Chichi), "the Godfather of Manga" (マンガの教父, Manga no Kyōfu) and "the God of Manga" (マンガの神様, Manga no Kami-sama). Additionally, he is often considered the Japanese equivalent to Walt Disney, who served as a major inspiration during Tezuka's formative years. Though this phrase praises the quality of his early manga works for children and animations, it also blurs the significant influence of his later, more literary, gekiga works.

Hiroki Hasegawa

Born in

Japan

Years

1977-.. (age 47)

Occupations

television actoractor

Biography

Hiroki Hasegawa, nicknamed Hasehiro-sama (ハセヒロ様), (born March 7, 1977 in Tokyo) is a Japanese stage, film, and television actor. Trained as a stage actor at the Bungaku-za after graduating from Chuo University, he first began to appear on Japanese TV in small roles in 2008, and then in films in 2011.

Heizō Takenaka

Born in

Japan

Years

1951-.. (age 73)

Occupations

economistinternational forum participantpoliticianbusinessperson

Biography

Heizō Takenaka is a Japanese economist, retired politician, and political activist last serving as Minister of Internal Affairs and Communications and Minister of State for Privatization of the Postal Services in the cabinet of Prime Minister Junichiro Koizumi. As of July 2007, he is a professor at Keio University and an advisor for other academic institutions and companies.

Akio Morita

Born in

Japan

Years

1921-1999 (aged 78)

Occupations

physicistbusinesspersonengineer

Biography

Akio Morita was a Japanese entrepreneur and co-founder of Sony along with Masaru Ibuka.

Daniel Schmidt

Born in

United States

Years

1992-.. (age 32)

Occupations

association football player

Biography

Daniel Schmidt is a professional footballer who plays as a goalkeeper for the Belgian Pro League club Gent. Born in the United States, he represents the Japan national team.

Hideki Yukawa

Born in

Japan

Years

1907-1981 (aged 74)

Enrolled in Osaka University

Graduated with Doctor of Philosophy

Occupations

physicisttheoretical physicistnuclear physicistprofessor

Biography

Hideki Yukawa was a Japanese theoretical physicist and the first Japanese Nobel laureate for his prediction of the pi meson, or pion.

Seishi Yokomizo

Born in

Japan

Years

1902-1981 (aged 79)

Occupations

novelist

Biography

Seishi Yokomizo was a Japanese mystery novelist, known for creating the fictional detective Kosuke Kindaichi.

Akira Yoshino

Born in

Japan

Years

1948-.. (age 76)

Enrolled in Osaka University

In 2005 graduated with Doctor in Engineering

Occupations

inventorengineerresearcherchemist

Biography

Akira Yoshino is a Japanese chemist. He is a fellow of Asahi Kasei Corporation and a professor at Meijo University in Nagoya. He created the first safe, production-viable lithium-ion battery, which became used widely in cellular phones and notebook computers. Yoshino was awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 2019 alongside M. Stanley Whittingham and John B. Goodenough.

Masaru Wakasa

Born in

Japan

Years

1956-.. (age 68)

Occupations

prosecutorpoliticianlawyer

Biography

Masaru Wakasa is a Japanese lawyer, politician and former member of the House of Representatives in Japan.

Suzuki Osamu

Born in

Japan

Years

1930-.. (age 94)

Occupations

chief executive officerentrepreneurbusinessperson

Biography

Osamu Suzuki is a Japanese businessman and the current Chairman of Suzuki Motor Corporation. He has been either president, chairman or CEO of the company since 1978. In February 2021, the company announced that Suzuki will retire in June 2021 and become an adviser.

Tetsurō Itodani

Born in

Japan

Years

1988-.. (age 36)

Occupations

professional shogi player

Biography

Tetsurō Itodani is a Japanese professional shogi player, ranked 8-dan and former Ryūō title holder.

Keizo Saji

Born in

Japan

Years

1919-1999 (aged 80)

Occupations

businessperson

Biography

Keizō Saji was a Japanese businessman and art patron. He was the 10th richest man in the world in 1987 according to Forbes, with a net worth of 4.0 billion dollars.

Hiroshi Ishiguro

Born in

Japan

Years

1963-.. (age 61)

Occupations

university teacherroboticistscientist

Biography

Hiroshi Ishiguro is a Japanese engineer and director of the Intelligent Robotics Laboratory, part of the Department of Systems Innovation in the Graduate School of Engineering Science at Osaka University, Japan. A notable development of the laboratory is the Actroid, a humanoid robot with lifelike appearance and visible behaviour such as facial movements.

Shinji Tarutoko

Born in

Japan

Years

1959-.. (age 65)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Shinji Tarutoko is a Japanese politician and former member of the House of Representatives.

Mitoji Yabunaka

Years

1948-.. (age 76)

Occupations

diplomat

Biography

Mitoji Yabunaka is the current Japanese Vice-Minister for Foreign Affairs in charge of administration. Prior to his current position, Yabunaka served as Ministry of Foreign Affair's Asian and Oceanian Affairs Bureau Director-General. He has been a diplomat for nearly forty years.

Chin Shunshin

Born in

Japan

Years

1924-2015 (aged 91)

Occupations

novelisttranslatorliterary critic

Biography

Chin Shunshin or Chen Shunchen was a Taiwanese and Japanese novelist, translator and cultural critic. He is best known for his historical fictions and mystery novels based on Chinese and Asian history, including First Opium War, Chinese History, Ryukyu Wind. He won numerous literary awards, including the Yoshikawa Eiji Prize for Literature and the Naoki Prize.

Hisashi Shinma

Born in

Japan

Years

1935-.. (age 89)

Occupations

businessperson

Biography

Hisashi Shinma is a Japanese booker and promoter. Shinma is noted for being an on-screen authority at the World Wrestling Federation, from 1978 to 1984, billed as the President of the promotion. He was succeeded by Jack Tunney.

Ryota Nagaki

Born in

Japan

Years

1988-.. (age 36)

Occupations

association football player

Biography

Ryota Nagaki is a Japanese footballer who plays as a midfielder for J1 League club Shonan Bellmare.

Mitsunari Musaka

Born in

Japan

Years

1991-.. (age 33)

Occupations

association football player

Biography

Mitsunari Musaka is a Japanese footballer who plays as a midfielder for Japanese club Giravanz Kitakyushu.

Milojko Spajić

Born in

Montenegro

Years

1987-.. (age 37)

Occupations

economist

Biography

Milojko "Mickey" Spajić is a Montenegrin politician and financial engineer serving as Prime Minister of Montenegro since October 2023. He also served as the Minister of Finance and Social Welfare in the Government of Montenegro and the cabinet of Zdravko Krivokapić from 2020 to 2022.

Yoshio Mochizuki

Born in

Japan

Years

1947-2019 (aged 72)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Yoshio Mochizuki was a Japanese politician of the Liberal Democratic Party, a member of the House of Representatives in the Diet (national legislature), and a Minister of the Environment. A native of Shimizu, Shizuoka and graduate of Chuo University, he was elected to the first of his four terms in the city assembly of Shimizu in 1975 and to the first of his two terms in the assembly of Shizuoka Prefecture in 1991. He was elected to the House of Representatives for the first time in 1996 as an independent. He was affiliated to the openly revisionist organization Nippon Kaigi.

Shizuo Kakutani

Born in

Japan

Years

1911-2004 (aged 93)

Enrolled in Osaka University

Studied in 1941-1941

Occupations

university teachermathematician

Biography

Shizuo Kakutani was a Japanese-American mathematician, best known for his eponymous fixed-point theorem.

Rachmat Gobel

Born in

Indonesia

Years

1962-.. (age 62)

Occupations

international forum participantpolitician

Biography

Rachmad Gobel is an Indonesian businessman and politician from Gorontalo. His family controls the company, Gobel Group which is now called PT. Panasonic Gobel Indonesia, an Indonesian division of Panasonic. He is also the former Minister of Trade and the Indonesian President's Special Envoy to Japan. Currently, he is the Deputy Speaker of the People's Representative Council.

Shizuo Akira

Born in

Japan

Years

1953-.. (age 71)

Occupations

university teacherphysicianimmunologist

Biography

Shizuo Akira is a professor at the Department of Host Defense, Osaka University, Japan. He has made ground-breaking discoveries in the field of immunology, most significantly in the area of innate host defense mechanisms.

Yūsuke Nakamura

Born in

Japan

Years

1952-.. (age 72)

Occupations

biologistsurgeonmedical researcherbiochemistgeneticist

Biography

Yusuke Nakamura is a Japanese prominent geneticist and cancer researcher best known for developing Genome-Wide Association Study (GWAS). He is one of the world's pioneers in applying genetic variations (Variable Number Tandem Repeat (VNTR) and Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP) markers) and whole genome sequencing, leading the research field of personalized medicine.

Tadamitsu Kishimoto

Born in

Japan

Years

1939-.. (age 85)

Occupations

university teacherphysicianimmunologist

Biography

Tadamitsu Kishimoto is a Japanese immunologist known for research on IgM and cytokines, most famously, interleukin 6.

Shoichi Sakata

Born in

Japan

Years

1911-1970 (aged 59)

Occupations

university teacherphysicist

Biography

Shoichi Sakata was a Japanese physicist and Marxist who was internationally known for theoretical work on the subatomic particles. He proposed the two meson theory, the Sakata model (an early precursor to the quark model), and the Pontecorvo–Maki–Nakagawa–Sakata neutrino mixing matrix.

Li Siguang

Born in

China

Years

1889-1971 (aged 82)

Occupations

politiciangeologist

Biography

Li Siguang, also known as J. S. Lee, was a Chinese geologist and politician. He was the founder of China's geomechanics. He was an ethnic Mongol. He made outstanding contributions, which changed the situation of "oil deficiency" in the country, enabling the large-scale development of oil fields to raise the country to the ranks of the world's major oil producers.

Hori Shigeru

Born in

Japan

Years

1901-1979 (aged 78)

Occupations

politicianjournalist

Biography

Shigeru Hori was a prominent Japanese politician who served in various cabinet positions, including Chief Cabinet Secretary, and was also Speaker of the House of Representatives of Japan. He was also the founder of the Liberal Party, and later served in senior positions in the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan.

Norihiko Hibino

Born in

Japan

Years

1973-.. (age 51)

Occupations

jazz musiciancomposer

Biography

Norihiko Hibino is a Japanese video game composer and saxophonist.

Pratiwi Sudarmono

Born in

Indonesia

Years

1952-.. (age 72)

Occupations

biologistastronautcivil servant

Biography

Pratiwi Pujilestari Sudarmono is an Indonesian scientist. She is currently a professor of microbiology at the University of Indonesia, Jakarta.

Satoshi Umemura

Born in

Japan

Years

1975-.. (age 49)

Occupations

politicianinternist

Biography

Satoshi Umemura is a Japanese politician of the Democratic Party of Japan, a member of the House of Councillors in the Diet (national legislature). A native of Sakai, Osaka and graduate of Osaka University, he was elected for the first time in 2007.

Osamu Hayaishi

Born in

United States

Years

1920-2015 (aged 95)

Occupations

university teacherphysicianbiochemistphysiologistchemist

Biography

Osamu Hayaishi MJA, was a Japanese biochemist, physiologist, and military physician. He discovered Oxygenases at the National Institute of Arthritis and Metabolic Diseases, National Institutes of Health in 1955.

Sadao Yamahana

Born in

Japan

Years

1936-1999 (aged 63)

Occupations

politicianlawyer

Biography

Sadao Yamahana was Japanese politician who served as chairman of the Japan Socialist Party from January 1993 to September 1993.

Yoshio Kimura

Years

1948-.. (age 76)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Yoshio Kimura is a Japanese politician of the Liberal Democratic Party and a member of the House of Councillors in the Diet (national legislature).

Hiroshi Imazu

Born in

Japan

Years

1946-.. (age 78)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Hiroshi Imazu is a Japanese politician of the Liberal Democratic Party, a former member of the House of Representatives in the Diet (national legislature). A native of Asahikawa on Hokkaido and graduate of Chuo University, he was elected to the first of his two terms in the city assembly of Asahikawa in 1975, to the first of his two terms in the Hokkaido Prefectural Assembly in 1983 and finally to the House of Representatives for the first time in 1990. Imazu is affiliated to the revisionist lobby Nippon Kaigi. After failing to win a seat in the 2017 Japanese general election he retired from politics. His son is Hirosuke Imazu, who became the mayor of Asahikawa in 2021.

Ryūmo Ono

Born in

Japan

Years

1988-.. (age 36)

Occupations

basketball player

Biography

Ryumo Ono is a Japanese professional basketball player for the Shinshu Brave Warriors club of the B.League in Japan.

Tanigawa Shūzen

Born in

Japan

Years

1934-.. (age 90)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Shuzen Tanigawa is a Japanese politician of the Liberal Democratic Party, a member of the House of Councillors in the Diet (national legislature). A native of Amagasaki, Hyogo and graduate of Osaka University, he joined the government of Osaka Prefecture in 1957. After serving as deputy mayor of Osaka Prefecture, he was elected to the House of Councillors for the first time in 1995.

Toshio Hirano

Born in

Japan

Years

1947-.. (age 77)

Occupations

university teacherphysicianimmunologist

Biography

Toshio Hirano is a Japanese immunologist and academic, best known for his discovery of interleukin-6. Since August 2011, he has served as the 17th President of Osaka University.

Matsuji Nakaizumi

Born in

Japan

Years

1979-.. (age 45)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Matsuji Nakaizumi is a Japanese politician from the Liberal Democratic Party. As of 2014 he served as member of the House of Councillors for Akita At-large district.

Masatoshi Gündüz Ikeda

Years

1926-2003 (aged 77)

Enrolled in Osaka University

Studied in 1948-1953

Occupations

professormathematician

Biography

Masatoşi Gündüz İkeda, was a Japanese-born Turkish mathematician known for his contributions to the field of algebraic number theory.

Kohei Murakoso

Born in

Japan

Years

1905-1998 (aged 93)

Occupations

athletics competitorlong-distance runner

Biography

Kohei Murakoso was a Japanese runner. He competed at the 1936 Olympics in the 5000 metres and 10,000 metres events and finished fourth on both occasions.

Wakamatsu Kaneshige

Born in

Japan

Years

1955-.. (age 69)

Occupations

politiciantax advisorcertified public accountantadministrative scrivener

Biography

Kaneshige Wakamatsu is a Japanese politician and accountant who has served as a member of the House of Councillors of Japan since 2013. He previously served as a member of the House of Representatives of Japan from 1993 to 2003. He represents the National proportional representation block as a member of Komeito.

Wataru Ito

Born in

Japan

Years

1969-.. (age 55)

Enrolled in Osaka University

In 1994 studied graduate school

Occupations

politicianbus driver

Biography

Wataru Itō is a Japanese politician of the New Komeito Party, a member of the House of Representatives in the Diet (national legislature). A native of Nagoya, Aichi, he attended Osaka University as both undergraduate and graduate students. After working at JR Central from 1994 to 2005, he was elected to the House of Representatives for the first time in 2005.

Kaoru Ōta

Born in

Japan

Years

1912-1998 (aged 86)

Occupations

activistpolitician

Biography

Kaoru Ōta was a Japanese trade union leader. He served as chairman of the General Council of Trade Unions of Japan (Sōhyō) from 1958 to 1966. Known for his cheerful demeanor and energetic activism, Ōta's many forceful statements in defense of the Japanese workers were affectionately known as the "Ōta Trumpet" (Ōta rappa).

Kilnam Chon

Born in

Japan

Years

1943-.. (age 81)

Occupations

teachercomputer scientist

Biography

Kilnam Chon is a South Korean computer scientist. As a result of his contributions, South Korea became the second country in the world to have the IPv4 network (the Internet), after the United States.<IEEE Communications Magazine, February 2013>

Kōsaku Yosida

Born in

Japan

Years

1909-1990 (aged 81)

Enrolled in Osaka University

Studied in 1933-1939

Occupations

university teachermathematician

Biography

Kōsaku Yosida was a Japanese mathematician who worked in the field of functional analysis. He is known for the Hille-Yosida theorem concerning C0-semigroups. Yosida studied mathematics at the University of Tokyo, and held posts at Osaka and Nagoya Universities. In 1955, Yosida returned to the University of Tokyo.

Yohei Hayashi

Born in

Japan

Years

1989-.. (age 35)

Occupations

association football player

Biography

Yohei Hayashi is a Japanese football player for Blaublitz Akita.

Kazuaki Shimoji

Born in

Japan

Years

1976-.. (age 48)

Occupations

basketball player

Biography

Kazuaki Shimoji is the former Head coach of the Toyama Grouses in the Japanese Bj League.

Motome Takisawa

Born in

Japan

Years

1958-.. (age 66)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Motome Takisawa is a Japanese politician from the Liberal Democratic Party. He currently serves as member of the House of Councillors for Aomori at-large district.

Yamato Inaba

Born in

Japan

Years

1943-.. (age 81)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Yamato Inaba is a Japanese politician, who was a member of House of Representatives and Liberal Democratic Party.

Mitsuo Mitani

Born in

Japan

Years

1959-.. (age 65)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Mitsuo Mitani is a Japanese politician of the Democratic Party of Japan, a member of the House of Representatives in the Diet (national legislature). A native of Kure, Hiroshima and graduate of Osaka University, he was elected to the House of Representatives for the first time in September 2005 after unsuccessful runs in 2003 and April 2005.

Yoshiaki Arata

Born in

Japan

Years

1924-2018 (aged 94)

Occupations

metallurgistengineer

Biography

Yoshiaki Arata was a Japanese physicist. Arata was one of the pioneering researchers into nuclear fusion in Japan and a former professor at Osaka University. He was reported to be a strong nationalist, speaking only Japanese in public. He received the Order of Culture in 2006.

Toshio Yanagida

Born in

Japan

Years

1946-.. (age 78)

Occupations

biophysicistbiochemistphysiologist

Biography

Toshio Yanagida is a Japanese biophysicist famous for his pioneer research in single molecule biology, and made important contributions to single molecule fluorescence microscopy.

Hidesaburō Hanafusa

Born in

Japan

Years

1929-2009 (aged 80)

Occupations

geneticistuniversity teachermolecular biologistvirologist

Biography

Hidesaburo Hanafusa was a Japanese virologist. He shared the 1982 Albert Lasker Award for Basic Medical Research with Harold E. Varmus and J. Michael Bishop for demonstrating how RNA tumor viruses cause cancer, and elucidating their role in combining, rescuing and maintaining oncogenes in the viral genome.

Kenkichi Sonogashira

Born in

Japan

Years

1931-.. (age 93)

Occupations

chemistuniversity teacher

Biography

Kenkichi Sonogashira is a Japanese chemist and was a professor of chemistry at Osaka University in Japan. He discovered the Sonogashira coupling in 1975. Sonogashira was later a professor at Osaka City University and retired in 2004.

Mamoru Morimoto

Years

1939-2021 (aged 82)

Occupations

middle-distance runnertrack and field coachathletics competitor

Biography

Mamoru Morimoto was a Japanese middle distance runner who competed in the 1964 Summer Olympics. His daughter Tsuru Morimoto is a former footballer who played for the Japanese national team.

Toshihiro Goto

Born in

Japan

Years

1966-.. (age 58)

Occupations

basketball player

Biography

Toshihiro Goto is the former Head coach of the Sendai 89ers in the Japanese B.League.

Fathimath Dhiyana Saeed

Born in

Maldives

Years

1974-.. (age 50)

Occupations

diplomat

Biography

Fathimath Dhiyana Saeed is a Maldivian diplomat, and was the Secretary-General of the South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation. She was the first woman to hold this post since the organization's inception in 1985. She was appointed Secretary-General at the Thirty-third Session of the SAARC Council of Ministers in February 2011, and assumed office in Kathmandu on 1 March 2011. She succeeded India's Sheel Kant Sharma, whose term ended in February.

Toshio Kojima

Born in

Japan

Years

1939-.. (age 85)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Toshio Kojima is a Japanese politician of the Liberal Democratic Party, a member of the House of Representatives in the Diet (national legislature). A native of Kumagaya, Saitama and graduate of Chuo University, he had served in the city assembly of Kumagaya for three terms since 1971 and in the assembly of Saitama Prefecture for four terms since 1983. He was elected to the House of Representatives for the first time in 1999.

Shōichi Watanabe

Born in

Japan

Years

1930-2000 (aged 70)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Shōichi Watanabe was a Japanese politician. He served in the House of Representatives of Japan as part of the multi-member constituency Hokkaido's 4th district alongside Yukio Hatoyama and Tadamasa Kodaira. He was a member of the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan.

Eikō Kaneta

Born in

Japan

Years

1942-2022 (aged 80)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Eiko Kaneta was a Japanese politician. A member of the Liberal Democratic Party, he served in the House of Representatives from 1993 to 2005.

Akira Hasegawa

Born in

Japan

Years

1934-.. (age 90)

Occupations

university teacherphysicist

Biography

Akira Hasegawa is a Japanese theoretical physicist and engineer who has worked in the U.S. and Japan. He is known for his work in the derivation of the Hasegawa–Mima equation, which describes fundamental plasma turbulence and the consequent generation of zonal flow that controls plasma diffusion. Hasegawa also made the discovery of optical solitons in glass fibers, a concept that is essential for high speed optical communications.

Yasuo Tanaka

Born in

Japan

Years

1931-2018 (aged 87)

Occupations

astronomeruniversity teacher

Seizō Wakaizumi

Born in

Japan

Years

1945-.. (age 79)

Occupations

politician

Kōji Sekimizu

Japan

Years

1952-.. (age 72)

Occupations

international forum participantdiplomat

Biography

Koji Sekimizu is a Japanese official who was Secretary General of the International Maritime Organization between 2012 and 2015, as well as Chancellor of the World Maritime University.

Kazuo Katsuramoto

Born in

Japan

Years

1934-.. (age 90)

Occupations

amateur wrestlerbaseball player

Biography

Kazuo Katsuramoto is a retired Japanese freestyle wrestler. In 1954 he won the −79 kg event at the Asian Games and finished third at the world championships. He shared fifth place at the 1956 Summer Olympics.

Jun-iti Nagata

Born in

Japan

Years

1925-2007 (aged 82)

Occupations

university teachertopologistmathematician

Biography

Jun-iti Nagata was a Japanese mathematician specializing in topology.

Sonia Antoranz Contera

Years

1970-.. (age 54)

Enrolled in Osaka University

1997-2000 graduated with Doctor of Philosophy

Biography

Sonia Antoranz Contera is a Spanish physicist. She serves as Professor of Biological Physics at the University of Oxford, a senior fellow at the Oxford Martin School, and a senior research fellow at Green Templeton College.

Kiyoshi Nagai

Born in

Japan

Years

1949-2019 (aged 70)

Occupations

biologistbiochemist

Biography

Kiyoshi Nagai was a Japanese structural biologist at the MRC Laboratory of Molecular Biology Cambridge, UK. He was known for his work on the mechanism of RNA splicing and structures of the spliceosome.

Shigeo Satomura

Born in

Japan

Years

1919-1960 (aged 41)

Occupations

physicist

Biography

Shigeo Satomura was a Japanese physicist credited with introducing the ultrasonic Doppler techniques to practical medical diagnostics in the 1950s. These techniques made possible non-invasive monitoring of blood flow in the human body.

Noboru Uchiyama

Born in

Japan

Years

1954-.. (age 70)

Occupations

boxer

Biography

Noboru Uchiyama is a retired Japanese amateur boxer. He won a bronze medal at the 1974 Asian Games and competed at the 1976 Olympics, where he was eliminated in the first bout.

Kintarō Yokoyama

Years

1868-1945 (aged 77)

Occupations

politicianjudgelawyer

Biography

Kintarō Yokoyama was mayor of Hiroshima from 1935 to 1939.

Kinjirō Nagai

Years

1874-1927 (aged 53)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Kinjiro Nagai was Director of the Karafuto Agency (April 17, 1919 – June 11, 1924). He was also mayor of Otaru and Governor of Kōchi Prefecture (1913–1914).

Wahid Shams Kolahi

Born in

Iran

Years

1965-.. (age 59)

Occupations

scientist

Biography

Wahid Shams-Kolahi is a scientist and an electrical engineer who is known for his research in photovoltaic-related technologies.
